message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of synthesizing frontal facing views of faces appearing in single unconstrained photos, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques for face recognition and gender estimation, which makes cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also proposes a new method for frontalization that is based on a single, unmodified, 3D surface, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.GR (Graphics).
